title: Physical AI + Robotics Total Solution
summary: Robotics LAB with on-device AI chips, 'Robotics Total Solution' integrating hardware and software for physical AI

content.whatItIs: Hyundai's Robotics LAB focuses on 'Physical AI'—AI that interacts with the physical world through robots. Unlike pure software AI labs, this combines hardware and software into an integrated 'Robotics Total Solution.'
howItWorks: Co-developed 'edge brain' on-device AI chip with DEEPX—began mass production at CES 2026
On-device AI enables robots to process without cloud latency
Strategy: 'Robotics Total Solution (RTS)' integrating hardware and software
Moving beyond individual robot products to platform approach
Physical AI implementation plan unveiled at CES Foundry 2026
content.coreInsight: Physical AI requires different organizational capabilities than software AI—tight integration between hardware (chips, motors, sensors) and software (models, control systems). The 'Robotics Total Solution' approach treats this as a platform problem.
content.keyMetrics: Edge brain chip in mass production as of CES 2026. Part of Hyundai's broader Boston Dynamics / robotics portfolio.
